cab.content: REPORT relating to the TFar Work of the Board of Agriculture for Scotland for week ending Oth January 1918.?-oo:o PRODUCTION.For most of the days of the week now ending ploughing has been impossible owing to frost prevailing in most parts of Scotland. In certain areas in addition to the frost there-has been a heavy fail of snow which has blocked roads and generally interrupted traffic.District Agricultural Committees.Cn the 8th instant the Board at the request of the Secretary for Scotland convened a Conference of Representatives of District Agricultural Committees in Edinburgh, &r Munro addressed the Conference on the subject of the Development of Forestry and In-creased Food Production. An interesting discussion arose on points connected with the Orders of the Food Controller, the Board8s Scheme for Tractor Ploughing, the.Supply of Labour, and other points more or less connected with the work of other Bepart-ments.
